title: Nickel Market Freeze Extended to Sort Out Big Trading Loss Amid Ukraine War
sub_head: The pause until next week gives the London Metal Exchange time to resolve a crisis caused by a trade that originated in China
body:
Londonâ€™s nickel market will stay closed at least until next week, giving the London Metal Exchange more time to resolve a crisis caused by a huge loss-making trade originating in China.
The LME paused trading in nickel Tuesday, the first time it had suspended a market since 1985, and canceled trades executed before the suspension. The exchange late Thursday extended the freeze through the end of the week.
